infodynamics.measures.discrete

Interface SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActiveInformationCalculatorDiscrete, BlockEntropyCalculatorDiscrete, EntropyCalculatorDiscrete, EntropyRateCalculatorDiscrete, SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator

    public interface SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete
    Interface for calculators of information-theoretic measures for single variables (e.g. entropy, active information storage). The interface defines common operations such as adding observations and calculating local and average values, etc.

    Usage is as per InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete, with many methods for supplying observations and making calculations defined here.

    It would ideally be an abstract class to be inherited from, but it's more important for some of our calculators to have inheritance from ContextOfPastCalculator, and since java doesn't allow multiple inheritance, one of them has to miss out. To get around this, we combine the two in SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator.

    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Method Detail

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(int[] states)
        Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs.
        Parameters:
        states - series of samples

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(int[][] states)
        Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to the PDFs.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable number)

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(int[][] states,
                   int col)
        Add observations for a single variable of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int[][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable number)
        col - index of agent

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(int[][][] states)
        Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable row number, 3rd is variable column number)

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(int[][][] states,
                   int index1,
                   int index2)
        Add observations for a single agent of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int[][][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable row number, 3rd is variable column number)
        index1 - row index index the variable
        index2 - column index of the variable

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
        Compute the average value of the measure from the previously-supplied samples. Must set average, min and max
        Returns:
        the estimate of the measure

      • computeLocalFromPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[] states)
        Computes local information theoretic measure for the given states, using pdfs built up from observations previously sent in via the addObservations method. Must set average, min and max
        Parameters:
        states - time series of samples
        Returns:
        time-series of local values (indexed as per states)

      • computeLocalFromPreviousObservations

        double[][] computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[][] states)
        Computes local information theoretic measure for the given states, using pdfs built up from observations previously sent in via the addObservations method. This method to be used for homogeneous agents only, since the local values will be computed for all variables. Must set average, min and max
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable number)
        Returns:
        2D time-series of local values (indexed as per states)

      • computeLocalFromPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[][] states,
                                            int col)
        Computes local information theoretic measure for the given variable in the 2D time-series states, using pdfs built up from observations previously sent in via the addObservations method. This method is suitable for heterogeneous agents, since the specific variable is identified. Must set average, min and max.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable number)
        col - index of the given variable
        Returns:
        time-series of local values for the variable

      • computeLocalFromPreviousObservations

        double[][][] computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[][][] states)
        Computes local information theoretic measure for the given states, using pdfs built up from observations previously sent in via the addObservations method This method to be used for homogeneous agents only, since the local values will be computed for all variables. Must set average, min and max
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable row number, 3rd is variable column number)
        Returns:
        3D time-series of local values (indexed as per states)

      • computeLocalFromPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[][][] states,
                                            int index1,
                                            int index2)
        Computes the local information theoretic measure for the given variable in the 3D time-series states, using pdfs built up from observations previously sent in via the addObservations method This method is suitable for heterogeneous agents, since the specific variable is identified. Must set average, min and max
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable row number, 3rd is variable column number)
        index1 - row index of the given variable
        index2 - column index of the given variable
        Returns:
        time-series of local values for the variable

      • computeLocal

        double[] computeLocal(int[] states)
        Standalone routine to compute the local information-theoretic measure across a time-series of states. Return a time-series array of local values. First history rows are zeros when the measure must build up embedded history of the variable.
        Parameters:
        states - time series of samples
        Returns:
        time-series of local values (indexed as per states)

      • computeLocal

        double[][] computeLocal(int[][] states)
        Standalone routine to compute the local information-theoretic measure across a 2D spatiotemporal array of the states of homogeneous agents, Return a 2D spatiotemporal array of local values. First history rows are zeros when the measure must build up embedded history of the variable.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable number)
        Returns:
        2D time-series of local values (indexed as per states)

      • computeLocal

        double[][][] computeLocal(int[][][] states)
        Standalone routine to compute the local information theoretic measure across a 3D spatiotemporal array of the states of homogeneous agents Return a 3D spatiotemporal array of local values. First history rows are zeros when the measure must build up embedded history of the variable.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable row number, 3rd is variable column number)
        Returns:
        3D time-series of local values (indexed as per states)

      • computeAverageLocal

        double computeAverageLocal(int[] states)
        Standalone routine to compute the average information theoretic measure across a time-series of states. Return the average.
        Parameters:
        states - time series of samples
        Returns:
        average of the information-theoretic measure.

      • computeAverageLocal

        double computeAverageLocal(int[][] states)
        Standalone routine to compute the average information theoretic measure across a 2D spatiotemporal array of the states of homogeneous agents. Return the average. This method to be called for homogeneous agents only, since all variables are used in the PDFs.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable number)
        Returns:
        average of the information-theoretic measure.

      • computeAverageLocal

        double computeAverageLocal(int[][][] states)
        Standalone routine to compute the average information theoretic measure across a 3D spatiotemporal array of the states of homogeneous agents. Return the average. This method to be called for homogeneous agents only, since all variables are used in the PDFs.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable row number, 3rd is variable column number)
        Returns:
        average of the information-theoretic measure.

      • computeLocal

        double[] computeLocal(int[][] states,
                    int col)
        Standalone routine to compute local information theoretic measure for one variable in a 2D spatiotemporal multivariate array. Return a time-series array of local values. First history rows are zeros when the measure must build up embedded history of the variable. This method should be used for heterogeneous agents
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable number)
        col - index of the given variable
        Returns:
        time-series of local values of the measure for the given variable

      • computeLocal

        double[] computeLocal(int[][][] states,
                    int index1,
                    int index2)
        Standalone routine to compute local information theoretic measure for one variable in a 3D spatiotemporal multivariate array. Return a time-series array of local values. First history rows are zeros when the measure must build up embedded history of the variable. This method should be used for heterogeneous agents
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable row number, 3rd is variable column number)
        index1 - row index of the given variable
        index2 - column index of the given variable
        Returns:
        time-series of local values of the measure for the given variable

        Returns:
